action.action-desc: Mr. Newhouse (for himself, Ms. Schrier, Ms. Strickland, Mr. Kilmer, Mr. Zinke, and Mr. Moolenaar) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the 21st Century Cures Act to require funds to be set aside for opioid reversal agent administration training in schools, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Overdose in Schools Act.

section.header: Pilot program for opioid reversal agent administration training

subsection.text: Section 1003 of the 21st Century Cures Act (42 U.S.C. 290ee–3a) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (h) and (i) as subsections (i) and (j), respectively; and
by inserting after subsection (g) the following:

subsection.header: Pilot program for opioid reversal agent administration training

paragraph.text: As part of the program established under this section, the Secretary shall establish a pilot program under which the Secretary will award grants to school districts—

subparagraph.text: to train school resource officers, security personnel, and school nurses in the administration of opioid reversal agents;
to purchase opioid reversal agent kits; and
to provide awareness of opioid use disorder and strategies for preventing overdose deaths.

paragraph.text: In selecting recipients of a grant under this subsection, the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.text: ensure that 50 percent of such recipients are school districts located in a rural area (as defined by the Secretary); and
in selecting the remaining 50 percent of recipients, give priority to school districts located in areas with high rates of drug-related overdoses by youth (as defined by the Secretary).

paragraph.text: As a condition on the receipt of a grant under this subsection, a school district shall agree that if the school district has a school resource officer or any security personnel, the officer (or personnel) must be trained in opioid reversal agent administration.

In this subsection, the term opioid reversal agent means an opioid antagonist or other drug that has been approved or otherwise authorized by the Food and Drug Administration to reverse the effects of an opioid.

subsection.text: Paragraph (3) of section 1003(j) of the 21st Century Cures Act (42 U.S.C. 290ee–3 note), as redesignated by subsection (a)(1), is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (B), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: of the amount remaining after application of subparagraphs (A) and (B), set aside not less than $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2024 and 2025 to carry out subsection (h).
